title: ICE: '`derive` attribute should exist', src/librustc_expand/expand.rs:505:1

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: A-macros
labels.description: Area: All kinds of macros (custom derive, macro_rules!, proc macros, ..)

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-stable
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from one stable version to another.

body:
````
git clone https://github.com/TrueWarg/grrs/
cd grrs
cargo check
````

### Code

```rust
use structopt::StructOpt;

#[derive(StructOpt)]
struct CLI {
    pattern: String,
    #[derive(parse(from_os_str))]
    path: std::path::PathBuf
}

fn main() {
}

```


### Meta

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.43.0-nightly (2c462a2f7 2020-02-20)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 2c462a2f776b899d46743b1b44eda976e846e61d
commit-date: 2020-02-20
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.43.0-nightly
LLVM version: 9.0
```

### Error output

```
    Checking grrs v0.1.0 (/tmp/grrs)
error: traits in `#[derive(...)]` don't accept arguments
 --> src/main.rs:6:19
  |
6 |     #[derive(parse(from_os_str))]
  |                   ^^^^^^^^^^^^^ help: remove the arguments

thread 'rustc' panicked at '`derive` attribute should exist', src/librustc_expand/expand.rs:505:13
stack backtrace:
   0: backtrace::backtrace::libunwind::trace
             at /cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/backtrace-0.3.44/src/backtrace/libunwind.rs:86

             at src/libstd/sys_common/backtrace.rs:78

             at src/libstd/sys_common/backtrace.rs:59

             at src/libcore/fmt/mod.rs:1052

             at src/libstd/io/mod.rs:1428

             at src/libstd/sys_common/backtrace.rs:62

             at src/libstd/sys_common/backtrace.rs:49

             at src/libstd/panicking.rs:204
   9: std::panicking::default_hook
             at src/libstd/panicking.rs:224
  10: rustc_driver::report_ice
  11: <alloc::boxed::Box<F> as core::ops::function::Fn<A>>::call
             at /rustc/2c462a2f776b899d46743b1b44eda976e846e61d/src/liballoc/boxed.rs:1031
  12: proc_macro::bridge::client::<impl proc_macro::bridge::Bridge>::enter::{{closure}}::{{closure}}
             at /rustc/2c462a2f776b899d46743b1b44eda976e846e61d/src/libproc_macro/bridge/client.rs:305
  13: std::panicking::rust_panic_with_hook
             at src/libstd/panicking.rs:474

             at src/libstd/panicking.rs:378

             at src/libcore/panicking.rs:85

note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace.

error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports

note: rustc 1.43.0-nightly (2c462a2f7 2020-02-20) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu

note: compiler flags: -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental -C target-cpu=native --crate-type bin

note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden

query stack during panic:
end of query stack
error: aborting due to previous error

error: could not compile `grrs`.

To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.
```
